task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

plan.reasoning: Bring the asammdf application to the foreground so subsequent UI actions target the correct window.
Capture current asammdf UI elements (menus, buttons, dialogs) before interacting, per the required workflow.
Open the Mode menu to ensure Batch processing mode is selected (required for batch concatenate operation).
Switch the application to Batch processing mode (precondition for concatenating multiple files).
Refresh UI state after mode change to discover Batch processing controls (Add files, operations, output fields).
Open the file selection dialog to add multiple .MF4 files from the target folder.
Capture the file-open dialog elements (File name edit, Open button) before typing the path to select files.
Focus the file dialog's File name field so we can enter the full path + wildcard to select all .MF4 files in the folder.
Enter the folder path with wildcard (*.mf4) and press Enter to select all MF4 files in the specified folder in the file-open dialog.
Give the file dialog time to resolve and select the matching files.
Confirm selection and add the matched .MF4 files to the Batch processing file list.
Refresh UI state to confirm files are listed in the batch and to discover operation controls (operation dropdown/button, sync option, output filename field).
Open the operation selector so we can choose the Concatenate operation.
Select the Concatenate operation to combine the selected files into a single continuous measurement file.
Update UI state to reveal any operation-specific options (e.g., 'Sync using measurement timestamps') and the output filename field/button.
Enable 'Sync using measurement timestamps' if present and desired to align files by timestamps before concatenation (optional but recommended when timestamps should be used).
Focus the output filename field so we can specify the full path and desired output filename for the concatenated file.
Enter the full output path and filename for the concatenated MF4 file (as requested: Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder).
Start the batch operation to perform concatenation and write the output file to the specified path.
Capture final state to verify that the concatenated file was created (look for status message, output file in list, or confirmation).

Use Batch processing mode to add all .MF4 files from the target folder (selected via file-open dialog using a wildcard), choose the Concatenate operation, optionally enable timestamp synchronization, set the explicit full output path and filename, and start the batch operation. Calling State-Tool before interactions ensures element identifiers are discovered and current; file dialog interactions use the File name edit to input the folder+wildcard and the output filename field for the final file path.
